messages.name: You
messages.content: Lately I wake up feeling like I already failed the day before anything starts. It's exhausting.

messages.name: Patryk
messages.content: Where do you feel that failure in your body when you wake up? Chest? Stomach?

messages.name: You
messages.content: Mostly in my chest. It's like a weight pressing down before I even open my eyes.

messages.name: Patryk
messages.content: Put your hand there now. Just for a moment. Can you feel it under your skin?

messages.name: You
messages.content: Yeah, it's tight. Like I'm bracing for something bad to happen even though nothing's wrong.

messages.name: Patryk
messages.content: That bracing — is it familiar? Do you remember when it started to feel like that?

messages.name: You
messages.content: I think it started around the time my sister moved out. I was 16. Everything got quiet after that.

messages.name: Patryk
messages.content: Quiet can be comforting, or lonely. What kind of quiet was it back then?

messages.name: You
messages.content: Lonely. Empty house, mom always working, dad barely around. I started talking to myself a lot.

messages.name: Patryk
messages.content: That voice you used with yourself — was it kind?

messages.name: You
messages.content: Not really. I was angry most of the time. At them, at me. Like I deserved it.

messages.name: Patryk
messages.content: You still carry that voice now, don't you? In small comments you barely notice.

messages.name: You
messages.content: Yes. Even when I do something good, I undercut it. Like it doesn't count.

messages.name: Patryk
messages.content: If you pause right now, can you hear that voice say anything? What does it sound like?

messages.name: You
messages.content: It says I’m lazy. That I’m just pretending to try.

messages.name: Patryk
messages.content: Is that true, or just familiar?

messages.name: You
messages.content: It’s familiar. I’ve heard it so many times, it became automatic.

messages.name: Patryk
messages.content: Automatic doesn’t mean accurate. Can you say one thing now that you know you did well?

messages.name: You
messages.content: I showed up for a friend last week. Even though I wanted to stay in bed.

messages.name: Patryk
messages.content: That’s not nothing. That’s presence. That’s resistance to the voice.

messages.name: You
messages.content: I want to believe that matters, but it fades so fast.

messages.name: Patryk
messages.content: Say it anyway. Out loud: 'That mattered.'

messages.name: You
messages.content: That mattered.

messages.name: Patryk
messages.content: Again, slower.

messages.name: You
messages.content: That... mattered.

messages.name: Patryk
messages.content: Did you feel that change, even a little?

messages.name: You
messages.content: Yes. Like it landed differently.

messages.name: Patryk
messages.content: It did. Because it came from your body, not just your brain.

messages.name: You
messages.content: Maybe I can trust that more often.

messages.name: Patryk
messages.content: You can. And you will. One repetition at a time.
